meanings.definition: Take back or regain possession of (something).
meanings.sent1: After losing his wallet, he had to reassume it from the lost and found.
meanings.sent2: She had to reassume her keys from her forgetful friend.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reassume its toy from the playful dog.
meanings.sent4: The sun will reassume its place in the sky after the storm passes.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to reassume the stolen painting to solve the case.

meanings.definition: Take on or resume (a role or responsibility).
meanings.sent1: The actor had to reassume his role in the play after being sick.
meanings.sent2: She will reassume her duties as class president next semester.
meanings.sent3: The superhero had to reassume his secret identity to save the day.
meanings.sent4: The captain will reassume control of the ship during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to reassume her position after the substitute left.

meanings.definition: To take back or take on again.
meanings.sent1: He needed to reassume his jacket before going out in the cold.
meanings.sent2: She decided to reassume her old hobby of painting.
meanings.sent3: The student had to reassume his study habits after a long break.
meanings.sent4: The company will reassume its focus on customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The team will reassume their winning strategy for the championship game.
